content:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92068#issuecomment-1007346825

I'm not seeing the direct cause of these spurious failures, perhaps someone could take a look? thanks.
perhaps something with the build machine is funky.. retried the pr
"system is shutting down" It is not unusual that the macos machines spontaneously get shut down. We can only guess why GitHub does that (upgrades? maintenance? load balancing?)

is there a way to get server logs of a running job btw?
If I click on a job and then on the gear icon in the upper right to "View raw logs" it always just reads something like

2022-01-07T16:44:37.0985144Z Waiting for a self-hosted or a hosted runner to pickup this job...
2022-01-07T16:44:41.2722200Z Job is waiting for a hosted runner to come online.
2022-01-07T16:44:48.8226748Z Job is about to start running on the hosted runner: GitHub Actions 45 (hosted)

That's 0% helpful :/
Not that I'm aware of. You just have to wait for it to print something, but I don't think there is a way to view previous output until it finishes.

thats so strange...
for travis you could just curl the logs :/
